dsls.markdown:
# Keep on Dancing! For part 2, you're going to create your own project. There are no puzzles here - instead there are a bunch of projects that show different ways to make more complex dance parties. You can do these levels _in any order_. Jump around to look at how something was done in a previous level, or combine concepts between the projects. Try them all, pick your favorite, and spend your time working on adding to that project to make it your own. Continue

Back and Forth

More Buttons

Get in Formation

Where'd They Go?

Dance Crews

Quarter Notes

Bass, Mid, Treble

Speed it Up, Slow it Down

https://studio.code.org/s/dance-extras-2.long_instructions:
# Back and Forth!

Sometimes you might want to create a pattern of dance moves you choose. This new block lets you do just that.

[blockly block][0]

The moves you choose above will repeat in sequence forever.

-   Create an alternating routine for the lead dancer at the front!
-   Use different numbers to change the rate at which the moves alternate. Try `1` or `0.5` to alternate more quickly!

authored_hints.alternate: The alternate block is in the "Dancers" category.

https://studio.code.org/s/dance-extras-2.long_instructions:
# More Buttons

This dance lets you control the dancers' properties in real time while they dance automatically. Try making other properties change when you press the buttons. For example:

-   Randomize the tint of the dancer when you press "down".
-   Add a group of dancers with a random layout when you press "space".

https://studio.code.org/s/dance-extras-2.short_instructions: Let's Get in Formation! (Click "More" for details)
https://studio.code.org/s/dance-extras-2.long_instructions:
# Let's Get in Formation!

Check out this dance that uses the [blockly block][0] block to change the backup dancers' formation throughout the dance. Try one of these ideas to extend it:

-   Create a second group of dancers in a different layout
-   Change layout when a key is pressed
-   Change a property when the dancers change formation

# Where'd They Go?

This dance shows and hides two different groups of dancers. Check it out, and then try adding your own flair.

-   Add another group of dancers
-   Show and hide dancers using the arrow keys
-   Hide all of the dancers and switch to an exciting background effect

# Dance Crews

Here's a dance off between two crews. The arrow keys control one of the dancers and the "w,a,s,d" keys control the other. Have a dance off with a friend, and then try to improve this dance off.

-   Add more keys to control dances
-   Make the backup dancers also respond when the keys are pressed
-   Alternate the dancer every 4 measures by setting their visibility

# Quarter Notes

Most of our dances have used whole measures, but each measure is made up of 4 quarter notes. This dance uses [blockly block][0] to make the dancer clap on every quarter note but only for the first 4 measures.

Try changing the numbers in the blocks to see how it changes the dance.

-   Experiment with other note durations (like 0.5 for a half note or 0.125 for an eighth note).
-   Add some other events.

https://studio.code.org/s/dance-extras-2.short_instructions: Bass, Mid, and Treble (Click "More" for details)
https://studio.code.org/s/dance-extras-2.long_instructions:
# Bass, Mid, and Treble

This dance uses "peak" events to trigger code when different parts of the music get loud. Try tinkering with different songs to see how they change the dance.

https://studio.code.org/s/dance-extras-2.display_name: Speed it Up, Slow it Down
https://studio.code.org/s/dance-extras-2.short_instructions: Speed it Up, Slow it Down (Click "More" for details)
https://studio.code.org/s/dance-extras-2.long_instructions:
# Speed it Up, Slow it Down

This final dance uses the [blockly block][0] block to control how fast each dancer moves. Try experimenting with different speeds during different points in the song. Feel free to keep tinkering on this dance, or return to any of the previous dances to make them even cooler.
